ygData.subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Digest Number 275
ygData.msgSnippet: Level 52 Shaman here. I ve noticed a couple of things. SoW speed varies with level, going up in speed from 9-50 (documented fact, see EQ Casters for
ygData.messageBody:
Level 52 Shaman here.

I've noticed a couple of things.

SoW speed varies with level, going up in speed from 9-50 (documented fact,
see EQ Casters for percentages).
Running Speed is hampered when your overweight. Overwieght also reduces your
agility.
Running Speed is *slightly* affected by the client side speed. If you stick
two people in a race, one on a high end machine, and one on a low end
machine that lags (is choppy, like a 233) due to machine speed (not 'net
latency), the faster machine will be slightly faster running.

I've done no testing at the 100 agility mark. It would be interesting to
test though. In the manual, which is nearly 95% inaccurate, it says agility
determines how fast you can run, yes. Heh....uh huh.....

-Leod
Fennin Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: Philip Stewart [mailto:stewartp@...]
Sent: May 15, 2000 9:59 AM
To: Jeremy Caswell
Cc: 'eqenchanters@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Digest Number 275


I don't think that is true sir. I have a human monk with 138 agility, and
he never carries more than 14 pounds, but he cannot run noticeably faster
than anyone else.

On Mon, 15 May 2000, Jeremy Caswell wrote:

> Ground speed is affected by agility and your current weight. is not
easily
> noticed except with SoW or Selo's, since it magnifies the effect. I first
> noticed the problem with my enchanter, a human, and a human cleric...
> neither were encumbered, but my enchanter was running much faster than the
> cleric. the only difference was his higher strength had him carrying more
> pounds. My Druid wood elf and a wood elf ranger, same agility.... druid
was
> faster, less weight. my druid vrs one with a agility buff, the agi buff
one
> was slightly faster, but when I got my agi to 100, I could keep up with
the
> buffed one, (in the 120s). We did those while at the same weight.... done
> at different weights, the heavy one always lagged behind.
>
> Conclusions...
> Weight is deciding factor... encumbrance only decreases your agility to
slow
> you down, but each pound slows you as well.
> Agility is a factor, but only to 100... which is max groundspeed at 0
weight
>
>
> I have 101 agility, SoW, and keep my weight around 55 pounds. I can run
> circles around anyone in my guild, even the other shamans and druids.
>
